comments.body: This has no place in vanilla Minecraft, but try the Chisels 'n' Bits mod.

This definitely has a place in Minecraft and can revolutionize how its played. If Jeb doesnt want furniture, fine, let us make our own. So disappointing to build large houses that cannot be furnished. This mod is the only reason why I even bother playing.
We should add pixel-blocks. A pixel block is a single pixel in the shape of a block. Like, removing 4095 pixels from a block would give you this.
While they have iron bars, I always thought they should have iron fences and gates. I mean these things exist in real life.
Agreed! To original post and to comment before me. Stone fence would be nice too along side the stone wall. Or make the fence connectable to the stone wall horizontally.

More gate and more redstone.
Very good.
Yes! We need an iron gate, or a barred-iron door. I hate having to use iron doors on my chicken coops! üêî
This is already in MC Earth, so why tf not?

This is exactly what I was thinking of as well. Nice to see a good post that actually surpassed the approval process this fast. This would be incredibly useful for auto resetting password locks and so much more. It's also a QOL since the current way to go back to page 1 is spamming the left arrow.

Building an adventure map where most things would be rather easy to reset, but sadly that's not true for the lectern. Your idea is awesome and would make things a whole lot easier, even a command would help a lot.
Please. Its been three years. This needs to change, and fast. I just needed it, and didn't realized it wasn't a feature already :(
Does this only work on Java?

was trying to make an elevator and dint have the space for an elaborate machine. i found my way here to find it was just a suggestion and not a feature. very sad we dont have this yet. heres a vote though!
I'm assuming the texture for such a block would be like a pile of the food?
Yes, carrot blocks please
That just sounds weird and unnecessary... not my favorite idea.
The only reason that Carrot Blocks and stuff like that aren't added in is because they don't exist.
Yes I also was thinking about this idea, since items like beetroot will have more use!!
I like this idea , it could be used for look's , just build a wagon and place a pile of Carrot's / Ect in it

I think this is a good idea. After seeing this years April Fools Poisonous Potato update I really liked the look of potato blocks.

Other than compact storage, food blocks would be wonderful for decoration. An example would be a food block with trap doors around it, making a "food basket" so to speak. Definitely spice up our kitchens.
You definitely need some more votes on this. The custom duration of notes would make recreating certain songs sound so much better.

I definitely agree with this. It would make music in Minecraft much easier to make. I usually have to look up the Minecraft wiki to check how many times I need to click the block so this would be pretty handy. Especially since I have to break the block and replace it if I overshoot the note.

Just one thing though. Perhaps instead of choosing how long a note plays for, maybe the length will depend on how long a redstone signal stays on the note. This would probably be a bit harder, but manageable.

But really, I'm surprised no one has seen this yet. It would be a great addition to the game, if not like a fix to the system.

I agree with @ThornVineRose on the fact that redstone signal duration into a noteblock should affect how long a note is held, the redstone community would love it I bet.

I‚Äôd also argue that there should be some sort of amplifier block that increases the loudness and reach of a noteblock sound for evert one amplifier you place on top. For example, one amplifier would amplify the sound by two times and then another on top would amplify the sound by two again and increase the radius it is heard by 10 blocks. Perhaps a limit of 12 could be applied (the same amount of blocks a piston can push) so as to not cause griefing by sound.

I firmly believe note blocks need an update and I do hope this post receives more attention.
I think signal strength should be volume, and signal length should be note duration.

I do like the idea of a Notebook GUI, but we could have something more simpler, like say for example we had sugar, we left click with the sugar to increase the tempo, and then we could use spider eyes to slow it down. (These are the items used to make speed and slowness potions.) I only say this because, you don't want to be backing out of a Notebook 24/7 also, how will you be able to access the GUI.

The buttons remaining are: the Menu button, the left/down D-Pad buttons and click left stick. (That for consoles). PC players have so many keys to use, that's why I didn't list them.
You can see the note in F3 debug info if you look at the block. But yeah adding duration/volume control and some kind of GUI would still be awesome.
I agree Mc Rat. This is a great opportunity to teach children that.
How about using the poisonous berries as decorations, just like the holly berry wreaths for Christmas.
But why

I agree, it should be possible to place ladders on the backs of stairs. There is no logical reason not to seeing as it is a flat surface indistinguishable from any equivalent  whole block when viewed from the back. Ladders were only limited in what blocks they could be placed on for logical reasons such as highly uneven surfaces to begin with if I am not mistaken. I see the fact that they can not be placed against the flat backs of stairs as being a minor oversight that should be corrected for the sake of consistency and convenience.

Yes it makes does not make sense but bro don't you dare to say that Minecraft has logic bcoz if you can put lava in a bucket ( which somehow doesn't melt ) and and anvil can be placed on a wheat crop ( somehow this wheat manages to take on an anvil but when a player *just* jumps on it it tramples üò¢ plz add an update in which you can place ladders on the back the stairs plz plzüòèüò∂

Many of us use stairs, upside-down or right-side-up, as decorative elements in walls.  We'd often like to put an access ladder on the back of the wall, either while building or as a way to get from one level to another of our structure, but if there's a layer of stairs adding texture to the other (front) side of the wall, we can't. Those of us used to being able to use ladders like this get annoyed when we switch to Bedrock to play with some friends on that platform and suddenly can't use one of our favorite building elements.

Hi, can you explain how you're looking for this to work? (For example, are you looking for a menu option? A command? An item?)

Constructive feedback helps us present requests to the team in a way that spells out what you may be looking for and generally focuses on three basic things:

  • WHAT you want done
  • WHY you want something done
  • HOW you want something done

Hope that helps. Thanks for your contribution!
You need reasoning for why it should be needed.
I think he‚Äôs talking about items

"Enderanium" sounds cool. Also, you could make:

Enderanium block: Emits light and just looks cool.

Reinforced ender pearl: Can be used infinite times.

TP block: Made with 1 enderanium block and 4 reinforced ender pearls, you can program it to teleport you to any coordinates in any dimension, no receiver needed.

End Amethyst would be a good ore. Purple would make sense. Other name choices are Amethyst, End Ore, or Enderite. Armour and tools would be a nice additional feature. A full suit could save you from the void by teleporting you back to solid ground or could just stay in your inventory even after death. If it teleport you back perhaps there is a cool down before it can save you again. Maybe teleportation abilities only come after enchanted. Just a few ideas.
I think a name based upon "finite" would be good, as it means end and plenty of materials end with "ite." Finite -> Fynite -> Phynite?
This sounds good, but PLEASE NAME IT ENDRIUM?
Netherite would have to be in the recipes for endrium armor and weapons so that they don't become irrelevant
Yesssssssssss but pls pls pls name is Endite!
Nice.
But it just gives the armor stand the name tag
Not working in 1.18.1
How can I put a name tag to a armor stand in MC Bedrock Ps5?
I like where this is going. But instead of using 1 shulker Shell, use 5, like the turtle helmet. That‚Äôs more  feasible
Sure.
pretty good idea
I like this idea. A shulker helmet sounds like something useful against shulkers. You have my vote.
No!  Just one shell is ok.  And you have a cool user name.
I'd even like if it only blocked shulker attacks only
Instead of no armor points, it should at least have have one armor point, like a leather helmet
If it is added, it should be called Uranium.  This would be better in a mod, though.
ANOTHER vegetable? No way.
Who wants broccoli? Not me. Great idea, though, as it adds more realism.
Oh!! So you mean one way glass

Hmmm... do you mean one-way glass? As in you can see through one way and not the other? Or do you mean that the glass is not transparent from any side, and it's just a solid block that looks like glass?
Great idea! There could also be an air attribute (more bubbles) and a food attribute (more total to hunger bar).

It would be great to add an weapon.range atribute with this we will make weapons like dagger or hallberd or spear without the use of mods or pluggins , a atribute tied to a scorboard to store data like it's enchantment or it's amout of xp neadeed to repare it or it's custom model data or ir's damaged value it would be great for map maker to have this tool !

This should be how it works:

After a few days, yellow ones convert into the white ones. When you blow on them, you spread the seeds randomly in an area ahead of you, and dandelions grow after a day or two there. If a player does not blow on them, after a while they are blown by wind and the seeds go in all directions. I know this would be complicated, but it would be more realistic.
That's sort of what end rods are; you can craft a popped chorus fruit with a blaze rod to make them.

I don't see that as a reason to make end rods unplaceable.

If anything that's a good argument to let blaze rods be placed. The blaze rod could also give off heat like furnaces or a torches. It's the unrefined version of the end rod.
Blaze Rods are one of my fav. items in game and I would love to see that being placed in my Nether room.
Blaze rods should only provide light when struck with a flint and steel. It would make a flame on the top of the rod like a candle

How about this: 1 Iron nugget below a blaze rod makes a blaze rod version of the end rod. And like Evan suggested, when ignited the rod it would give off a light source. Except I don't think it should have a flame on top of it but all around the rod instead.
What if we had more?  I‚Äôll tell you what will happen if we have more.  The game will get very confusing, that‚Äôs what!

I love this idea but here are a few suggestions for spells and how wands can be obtained. This comment only focuses on the spells so i'll make another comment about the wands, wizards, and dark wizards. 

Spells

Rift spell- allows the player to teleport to any dimension without a portal

Cloud spell- turns the player into a cloud (that's the color of their wand)

Instant kill spell- costs 10 exp and has  a 25% chance of giving the player a de-buff

Stone spell- turns mobs to stone

Corruption spell- turns the mob into a dark wizard this spell doesn't work on animals ravegers, striders, spiders, endermites, silver fish, guardians, elder guardians, shulkers, vex, hoglins, zoglines, zombified piglins, ghasts, slimes, magma cubes, phantoms, wither, and ender dragon

Purification spell- (can only be used on mobs that were turned into dark wizards) turns dark wizards back into the mob they were before

Wizards and Dark wizards

there are 2 types of wizards both give you a wand but each teach you a different type of magic

Wizard are a type of evokers who only attack you if you attack them. If you'd like to receive training you'll need to give the wizard a a mushroom. Wizard training would most likely just be brewing potions, gathering materials, and learning spells. At the end of wizard training you'd make your own wand (somehow) out of something only a wizard would have. Completing your training will give the advancement Magic Man. Wizards use the purification spell to turn dark wizards back into regular mobs, they can also use the spell on the player.

Dark wizards are a powerful version of the evokers who attack you on sight. To receive dark wizard training you'd need to give them an end crystal. This training is just learning spells on your own and your given a stick to preform spells, you learn dark magic from a dark wizard and at the end the dark wizard will use the corruption spell to turn you into a dark wizard, which will give you the advancement Master of the dark arts. The player can use the corruption spell on other mobs to turn them into an army of dark wizards which may or may not betray you. Dark magic uses souls instead of exp, the player can use these souls to cast spells and if they don't have enough souls for a spell they are effected with a debuff for 10 seconds. In order to gain more souls is by killing.
Oi vamos jogar agora

I like the creativity and usefulness of the idea, but why limit the night vision to below y=34?

I wonder what the drop rate of this pelt would be, and how many you would need to craft the cap?  I would think it would have similar protection value and durability as leather armor.  It being able to break seems to me like a better weakness than limiting the y level where it works.

Maybe with the cap, instead of making it like a regular helmet, it could be a hood? You would use 8 pelt in the recipe to make a chest, then the hood would grant you night vision, but the durability would be low.

Another idea is maybe be able to make boots using the pelts? The boots would have the ability to give the player slow fall, at the expense of durability at jump, which makes you want to only use the boots in dire situations, like a horde of mobs you can't fight off because your sword broke? You could also have another item to have to craft the boots with, to make it more expensive so it isn't abused?
I'd be all for this idea if bats actually had night vision. Most bats are basically blind and use echolocation, not sight.
Yeah they really should have bats have a small chance to drop something at least

I think night vision cap is very very great idea!

But I want that we can make the cap into different item like leather/potion

Just letting you know, it's called a NOT gate.

And these aren't needed. The beauty of redstone is using your creativity to make these circuits yourselves. Only if these were fairly lategame and significantly simplified and compacted redstone, would this be a suitable suggestion.
I love this idea
Maybe enchant your gear first. There are many ways to raid a bastion.
There could be an alternative way to craft the netherite upgrade. Then you will never need to go to a bastion.
I completely agree. Why would anyone need a template for smithing, anyway? You don‚Äôt need templates for crafting.

I agree. For most players getting netherite was already a pretty stretched goal. So for most of us the netherite upgrade makes getting netherite pretty much impossible. It‚Äôs not worth it anymore. It should be reverted back to the way it was before.
I seriously agree. It's such a pain having to find Netherite Upgrade Templates when it's already hard enough to find ancient debris. It's honestly just unfair and unnecessary.

Uhh yeahh i know im kinda two years late...buut raiding bastions is really easy if you know what your'e doing, and when you do get the netherite upgrade and get home safely and build your netherite gear your's gonna feel like you just got the best gear in the game (which it is). (Tip: when raiding bastions wear an enchanted golden helmet and use lava to kill brute piglins because that way you wont trigger the other piglins, so that they won't attack you.)
I voted for this but there are mods that make it so you don't need smithing templates, a plugin too
now with mounts update, we should demand netherite horse armor once more, especially when snail dude gets his..

This sounds amazing!!

And I have another idea, when you use it on the armor, it charges it up and makes it run down slower as well as +1 or +0.5 armor per piece!

I love this idea you could also make teleportation powers if you have the full set on
